name: maivi
description: Maivi - My AI Voice Input: Real-time voice-to-text local on cpu better than whisper with hotkey support
readme_summary: Maivi is a cross-platform desktop application that provides real-time voice-to-text transcription. It uses AI models to convert speech into text, which is then displayed in a floating overlay and automatically copied to the clipboard. The application supports hotkey activation (Alt+Q) for starting and stopping recording and works on CPU, with optional GPU acceleration.
primary_use_case: Real-time voice-to-text transcription for desktop users.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled scribe sitting at a digital scroll, listening intently to a flowing stream of spoken words represented by sound waves emanating from a microphone. As the scribe listens, the words magically appear on the scroll in real-time, glowing with a soft light. The scroll is connected to a clipboard icon, indicating automatic saving. Subtle UI elements float around the scribe, displaying transcription settings and audio levels. The scene is set in a minimalist, futuristic study with soft, ambient lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a calming color palette.

name: ThinkDashboard
description: A lightweight, self-hosted bookmark dashboard with keyboard shortcuts.
readme_summary: ThinkDashboard is a lightweight, self-hosted bookmark dashboard designed for quick access to frequently used websites. It offers a minimalist interface, keyboard shortcuts, customizable categories, and theme support, allowing users to efficiently organize and access their bookmarks.
primary_use_case: Organizing and quickly accessing bookmarks through a self-hosted dashboard.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a librarian standing in front of a vast, glowing digital library, organizing floating bookmarks into neatly arranged shelves. Each shelf represents a category, and the librarian uses a keyboard to quickly file each bookmark with a keystroke. The bookmarks glow with different colors, representing different websites. Small UI elements float nearby, showing the dashboard interface and configuration options. The scene is set in a futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines, vibrant colors, and a focus on clarity and organization.

name: voidauth
description: Single Sign-On for Your Self-Hosted Universe üêà‚Äç‚¨õüîí
readme_summary: VoidAuth is an open-source single sign-on (SSO) and user management provider designed for self-hosted applications. It offers features like OpenID Connect (OIDC) support, proxy forward authentication, user self-registration, customizable branding, and passkey support, aiming to simplify authentication and user management for self-hosted environments.
key_features: Secure Password Reset with Email Verification
Encryption-At-Rest with Postgres or SQLite Database
primary_use_case: Providing single sign-on (SSO) and user management for self-hosted applications.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, armored cat (representing VoidAuth) standing guard in front of a series of colorful, self-hosted application icons arranged like houses in a neighborhood. The cat holds a glowing key (representing SSO) that unlocks each application with a single touch. Digital particles flow from the key to each application, symbolizing secure access. A small UI element showing a login screen is subtly placed near the cat. The scene is set in a bright, cheerful environment with a clear sky. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and vibrant colors.

name: social-analyzer
description: API, CLI, and Web App for analyzing and finding a person's profile in 1000 social media \ websites
readme_summary: Social Analyzer is a tool designed for analyzing and finding a person's profile across numerous social media websites. It offers an API, CLI, and web application interface, incorporating various analysis and detection modules with a rating mechanism to minimize false positives. It can be used to investigate profiles related to suspicious activities.
key_features: Find a profile using multiple techniques (HTTPS library & Webdriver)
Visualized profile information using Ixora (Metadata & Patterns)
Search by top ranking or by country (Alexa Ranking)
Profiles stats and static info (Category country)
Custom search queries (Google API & DuckDuckGo API - optional)
Profile screenshot, title, info, and website description
Find name origins, name similarity & common words by language
Custom user-agent, proxy, timeout & implicit wait
Python CLI & NodeJS CLI (limited to FindUserProfilesFast option)
Grid option for faster checking (limited to docker-compose)
Dump logs to folder or terminal (prettified)
Filter profiles by good, maybe, and bad
Save the analysis as a JSON file
primary_use_case: Analyzing and finding a person's profile across social media platforms for OSINT investigations, including detecting suspicious or malicious activities.
cover_image_prompt: A detective meticulously piecing together a fragmented social media profile on a digital corkboard. The detective uses a magnifying glass to examine various social media icons and profile snippets pinned to the board, connecting them with glowing threads. Small screens display code snippets and data visualizations related to profile analysis. The scene is set in a dimly lit, high-tech office with a focused atmosphere. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with detailed textures and a cool color scheme.

name: work-tuimer
description: Simple, keyboard-driven TUI for time-tracking that allows you to quickly add time blocks and automatically group time if same task was done in different sessions
readme_summary: WorkTUImer is a simple, keyboard-driven terminal UI (TUI) application built in Rust for time-tracking. It allows users to quickly add time blocks, automatically group time spent on the same task across different sessions, and manage their work logs efficiently using only the keyboard.
key_features: Active timer tracking with start/stop/pause functionality
Time input using a PIN-like interface
Automatic calculation of task and break durations
Local auto-saving of data in JSON format
Optional ticket integration with JIRA, Linear, and GitHub
primary_use_case: Time-tracking and work logging for individuals who prefer a keyboard-centric, terminal-based interface.
cover_image_prompt: A meticulous clockmaker, hunched over a large, intricate clockwork mechanism, carefully adjusts tiny gears representing different tasks. Each gear is labeled with icons representing common work activities. The clock face displays a clear, well-organized time log. Digital particles subtly highlight the flow of time and the connections between tasks. A small terminal window in the background shows a simplified TUI with time entries. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop with a clean, organized aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: pipelight
description: Tiny automation pipelines. Bring CI/CD to the smallest projects. Self-hosted, Lightweight, CLI only.
readme_summary: Pipelight is a lightweight, self-hosted CI/CD tool written in Rust, designed for small projects. It allows users to define automation pipelines using various configuration languages (TOML, HCL, YAML, TypeScript) and trigger them based on events like Git hooks or file changes.
key_features: Pipeline definition using TOML, HCL, YAML, or TypeScript
primary_use_case: Automating repetitive tasks and implementing CI/CD pipelines in small projects.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent gardener tending to a miniature automated garden, where each plant represents a different task in a software project. The gardener uses a control panel with TOML, YAML, and TypeScript symbols to manage the watering and sunlight for each plant, triggering automated growth cycles. Small screens display code snippets and pipeline status updates. The garden is enclosed in a glass dome, subtly displaying the 'pipelight' logo. The scene is brightly lit with a focus on clarity and efficiency. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clean lines.

name: arch-cleaner
description: A bash script to perform routine maintenance and cleanup tasks on Arch Linux systems.
readme_summary: Arch-Cleaner is a bash script designed for Arch Linux systems to automate routine maintenance and cleanup tasks. It offers features such as system updates, removal of orphaned packages, cleaning the pacman cache and journal logs, and temporary file removal, with options for aggressive cleaning and backups.
primary_use_case: Automating system maintenance and cleanup on Arch Linux systems.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent housekeeper robot tidying up a digital cityscape representing an Arch Linux system. The robot uses specialized tools to remove dust bunnies made of old packages and clear clogs in the data streams. One hand holds a vacuum sucking up temporary files, while the other scrubs away outdated cache files. Small screens on the robot display system logs and cleanup progress. The cityscape glows with renewed efficiency. The scene is set in a bright, clean digital environment. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.
